tit.e: Shoya (village headman)
Shoya (village headman)
Shoya (village headman)

sen.j: 庄屋（しょうや）・名主（なぬし）は、江戸時代の村役人（村方三役）のひとつ、あるいは町役人のひとつである。
sen.e: The Shoya (village headman) and the Nanushi (village headman) would of either been a one of village officers ("murakata-sanyaku" in Japanese; the three officers of a village), or one of the machiyakunin (municipal officials).

The Shoya (village headman) and the Nanushi (village headman) are one of village officers ("murakata-sanyaku" in Japanese; the three officers of a village), or one of the machiyakunin (municipal officials) in Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「江戸時代の」訳漏れ。would of either been を除きました。
sen.e: The Shoya (village headman) and the Nanushi (village headman) are one of village officers ("murakata-sanyaku" in Japanese; the three officers of a village), or one of the machiyakunin (municipal officials) in Edo period.

sen.j: 村の庄屋・名主は、地方三役のひとつで、村落の代表者である。
sen.e: Each Shoya and Nanushi of a village were to of been assigned as one of the three officers of a village ("jikata-sanyaku" in Japanese), and the official representative person for the village.
Each Shoya and Nanushi of a village was one of the three officers of a village ("jikata-sanyaku" in Japanese), and the official representative person for the village.
sen.cmt: to of been assigned as を除きました。were→was に修正しました。
sen.e: Each Shoya and Nanushi of a village was one of the three officers of a village ("jikata-sanyaku" in Japanese), and the official representative person for the village.

sen.j: 西日本では庄屋の呼称が多く、東日本では名主と呼ばれることが多い。
sen.e: In western Japan, the term Shoya was the commonly used name, and Nanushi was the commonly used name in eastern Japan.
In western Japan, the term Shoya was the commonly used name, and Nanushi was the commonly used name in eastern Japan.
In western Japan, the term Shoya was the commonly used name, and Nanushi was the commonly used name in eastern Japan.

sen.j: また、東北地方･北陸地方では肝煎と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Additionally, in the regions of Tohoku and Hokuriku, the term Kimoiri (a sponsor, a middleman, and also a village official) was the commonly used name.
Additionally, in the regions of Tohoku and Hokuriku, the term Kimoiri (sponsorship) was the commonly used name.
sen.cmt: Kimoiriの括弧内の補足を修正しました。
sen.e: Additionally, in the regions of Tohoku and Hokuriku, the term Kimoiri (sponsorship) was the commonly used name.

sen.j: 町の名主・庄屋は、町役人（ちょうやくにん）のひとつで、町（ちょう）の代表者である。
sen.e: A Shoya and Nanushi of a town would have been one of the machi-yakunin (municipal officials) and the official representative person of the town.
Each Shoya and Nanushi of a town was one of the machi-yakunin (municipal officials) and the official representative person of the town.
sen.cmt: a→each, were→was に修正しました。
sen.e: Each Shoya and Nanushi of a town was one of the machi-yakunin (municipal officials) and the official representative person of the town.

sen.j: 町名主（ちょうなぬし）・町庄屋（ちょうしょうや）・支配名主（しはいなぬし）ともいう。
sen.e: To then Japanese, a town headman would be referred to as a Cho-Nanushi (a town headman), Cho-Shoya (a town headman), and Shihai-Nanushi (a town headman).
It is also called a Cho-Nanushi (a town headman), Cho-Shoya (a town headman), and Shihai-Nanushi (a town headman).
sen.cmt: To then～as→It is also called～としました。
sen.e: It is also called a Cho-Nanushi (a town headman), Cho-Shoya (a town headman), and Shihai-Nanushi (a town headman).

sen.j: 町名主（まちなぬし）は俗称である。
sen.e: Machi-Nushi was a familiar name for a town headman.
Machi-Nushi was a familiar name for a town headman.
Machi-Nushi was a familiar name for a town headman.

tit.e: Shoya and Nanushi of a village
Shoya and Nanushi of a village
Shoya and Nanushi of a village
Function
Function
Function

sen.j: 村請村落の下で年貢諸役や行政的な業務を村請する下請けなどを中心に下請けした。
sen.e: Under the Murauke (also called "Murauke-sei"; a subcontracting system for a village in the Edo period), a village Shoya or Nanushi engaged in the administration of subcontract works; this would mainly be for taxations, nengu (land tax) and miscellaneous taxes, and other administrative business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Under the Murauke (also called "Murauke-sei"; a subcontracting system for a village in the Edo period), a village Shoya or Nanushi engaged in the administration of subcontract works, mainly for taxations such as nengu (land tax) and miscellaneous taxes, and other administrative business.
sen.cmt: this would be を除きました。
sen.e: Under the Murauke (also called "Murauke-sei"; a subcontracting system for a village in the Edo period), a village Shoya or Nanushi engaged in the administration of subcontract works, mainly for taxations such as nengu (land tax) and miscellaneous taxes, and other administrative business.

sen.j: また、村民の法令遵守・上意下達・人別支配・土地の管理などの支配に関わる諸業務を下請けした。
sen.e: Other Murauke subcontracting duties were to include various business relating to control over the village's residents: Horei junshu (compliance with laws and ordinances), Joikatatsu (conveying the will of the governing to the governed), Ninbetsu shihai (census-taking control), and land management.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Also, they subcontracted various business concerning the control over the village's residents: Horei junshu (compliance with laws and ordinances), Joikatatsu (conveying the will of the governing to the governed), Ninbetsu shihai (census-taking control), and land management.
sen.cmt: Other～include→Also, they subcontracted, relating to→concerning としました。
sen.e: Also, they subcontracted various business concerning the control over the village's residents: Horei junshu (compliance with laws and ordinances), Joikatatsu (conveying the will of the governing to the governed), Ninbetsu shihai (census-taking control), and land management.

sen.j: いわゆる支配の末端機関に位置していた。
sen.e: In other words, under the Murauke subcontracting system the Shoya or Nanushi were positioned in the forefront, administrating organizational control.
In other words, they were positioned in the smallest unit of a controlling organization.
sen.cmt: under～Nanuchi→they were, in the forefront 以降を修正しました。
sen.e: In other words, they were positioned in the smallest unit of a controlling organization.

sen.j: しかし、一方で、村落の代表者として、年貢の減免運動の先頭に立つなど、村民の利害を代表して行動した。
sen.e: However on the other hand, as a representative of a village a Shoya or Nanushi represented his interest for the benefit of the village residents; such as, acting as a leader of a protest movement toward a reduction and or exemption from a nengu (land tax).

However, on the other hand, as a representative of a village a Shoya or Nanushi represented his interest for the benefit of the village residents; such as, acting as a leader of a protest movement toward a reduction and/or exemption from a nengu (land tax).
sen.cmt: コンマを足し、and or→and/or としました。
sen.e: However, on the other hand, as a representative of a village a Shoya or Nanushi represented his interest for the benefit of the village residents; such as, acting as a leader of a protest movement toward a reduction and/or exemption from a nengu (land tax).

sen.j: このような村民を代表する側面を「惣代機能」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: These distinctly representative characteristics of the Shoya or Nanushi to the village came to known as "Soudaikinou."
Such an aspect that the Shoya or Nanushi represented to the village is known as 'Soudaikinou.'
sen.cmt: クオーテーションマークを修正、These～came to の部分を変えました。
sen.e: Such an aspect that the Shoya or Nanushi represented to the village is known as 'Soudaikinou.'

sen.j: このような支配の末端としての機能と村民の代表者としての機能は相反するものでである。
sen.e: In practice, such functions of the Shoya or Nanushi at the front end of organizational control and the representation for the village residents were contradictive.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In practice, such functions of the Shoya or Nanushi as the smallest unit of a controlling organization and as the representation for the village residents were contradictive.
sen.cmt: at the front end～→as the smallest～ としました。
sen.e: In practice, such functions of the Shoya or Nanushi as the smallest unit of a controlling organization and as the representation for the village residents were contradictive.

sen.j: 近世を通じて、庄屋・名主の行動を不安定なものとした。
sen.e: Thus, through early-modern times the influence of the contradictive nature in the practice of their functions resulted in a negative influence upon the Shoya and Nanushi, and destabilized the intent of their actions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thus, through early-modern times it resulted in a negative influence upon the Shoya and Nanushi and destabilized the intent of their actions.
sen.cmt: 上記の文と続いていると思われる為、the influence～functionsの部分を省きました。
sen.e: Thus, through early-modern times it resulted in a negative influence upon the Shoya and Nanushi and destabilized the intent of their actions.

sen.j: 用水路など土木工事の監督もした。
sen.e: Shoya or Nanushi directed public works (engineering works) such as an irrigation channel.
Shoya or Nanushi directed public works (engineering works) such as an irrigation channel.
Shoya or Nanushi directed public works (engineering works) such as an irrigation channel.

sen.j: 庄屋が作ったものとして現在に残るものがある。
sen.e: Constructions projects of the Shoya heritage exist today.
Some constructions Shoya built still remain today.
sen.cmt: the Shoya heritage→Shoya built, exist→remain として全体を修正しました。
sen.e: Some constructions Shoya built still remain today.

sen.j: 近世後期に至り領主権力が弱体化すると、幕藩領主は庄屋・名主の惣代機能を否定しようと試みた。
sen.e: At end of the early-modern times, when the power of the feudal lords waned, a lord of the shogunate system tried to deny the Soudaikinou (a function of village residents' representative) function of a Shoya and Nanushi.

In the late modern times, when the power of the feudal lords waned, a lord of the shogunate system tried to deny the Soudaikinou (a function of village residents' representative) function of a Shoya and Nanushi.
sen.cmt: 近代後期をin the late modern times としました。
sen.e: In the late modern times, when the power of the feudal lords waned, a lord of the shogunate system tried to deny the Soudaikinou (a function of village residents' representative) function of a Shoya and Nanushi.

sen.j: 「取締役」などの新たな役職を設置する場合もあった。
sen.e: In some cases, a load of the shogunate system would establish a new position for a village, the "Torishimariyaku."
In some cases, a load of the shogunate system established new positions such as 'Torishimariyaku' for a village.
sen.cmt: would establish→established, a new position→new positions とし、'Torishimari' の位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In some cases, a load of the shogunate system established new positions such as 'Torishimariyaku' for a village.

sen.j: しかし、近世を通じて、庄屋・名主の惣代機能を払拭することはできなかった。
sen.e: Howevr, through out the early-modern times, lords of the shogunate system could not wipe out the 'Soudaikinou' function of a Shoya and Nanushi.
Howevr, through out the early-modern times, lords of the shogunate system could not wipe out the 'Soudaikinou' function of a Shoya and Nanushi.
Howevr, through out the early-modern times, lords of the shogunate system could not wipe out the 'Soudaikinou' function of a Shoya and Nanushi.

sen.j: 明治政府の課題として持ち越されることになったのである。
sen.e: The assignment of the Soudaikinou function of Shoya and Nanushi would be passed on during the Meiji government.
The assignment of the Soudaikinou function of Shoya and Nanushi would be carried over to the Meiji government.
sen.cmt: passed on during→carried over to としました。
sen.e: The assignment of the Soudaikinou function of Shoya and Nanushi would be carried over to the Meiji government.

tit.e: Selection procedures and compensation for the position of a Shoya and Nanushi
Selection procedures and compensation for the position of a Shoya and Nanushi
Selection procedures and compensation for the position of a Shoya and Nanushi

sen.j: 庄屋・名主の選出方法は、個々の村々の慣習に委ねられることが多い。
sen.e: The procedures for the selection of a Shoya or Nanushi were often dependent upon the customs of each individual village.
The procedures for the selection of a Shoya or Nanushi were often dependent upon the customs of each individual village.
The procedures for the selection of a Shoya or Nanushi were often dependent upon the customs of each individual village.

sen.j: (1)代々同じ家が就任する世襲名主制、(2)一年ごとに交代する年番名主制、(3)その中間型（世襲ではないがある者が複数年勤める形）の3つがあった。
sen.e: There were three selection procedures for the position: (1) the Heredity Nanushi system would require the legacy in a member of the same family having successively assumed an office in a Nanushi or Shoya position; (2) the Nenban Nanushi system required a yearly family rotation; resulting in different village family being chosen to carry out the position yearly; (3) the final procedural type was a hybrid of the former two (This type was not heredity, but certain persons served in the position for several years.).

There were three selection procedures for the position: (1) the Heredity Nanushi system would require the legacy in a member of the same family having successively assumed an office in a Nanushi or Shoya position; (2) the Nenban Nanushi system required a yearly family rotation; (3) the final procedural type was a hybrid of the former two (This type was not heredity, but certain persons served in the position for several years).
sen.cmt: ; resulting～position yearly を原文にないため除きました。括弧内のピリオドを消去しました。
sen.e: There were three selection procedures for the position: (1) the Heredity Nanushi system would require the legacy in a member of the same family having successively assumed an office in a Nanushi or Shoya position; (2) the Nenban Nanushi system required a yearly family rotation; (3) the final procedural type was a hybrid of the former two (This type was not heredity, but certain persons served in the position for several years).

sen.j: また、庄屋・名主の選出には、村民による「入札」（いれふだ）と呼ばれる選挙が実施される場合もあった。
sen.e: Additionally, there were cases that residents of a village executed an election called the "Irefuda (vote)" to select a Nanushi or Shoya.
Additionally, there were cases that residents of a village executed an election called 'Irefuda' (vote) to select a Nanushi or Shoya.
sen.cmt: クオーテーションマークを修正しました。
sen.e: Additionally, there were cases that residents of a village executed an election called 'Irefuda' (vote) to select a Nanushi or Shoya.

sen.j: そのあり方は、地域差があるばかりではなく、同じ地域内でも村ごとに多様である。
sen.e: The desired forms in the selection procedures were entirely dependent upon the various regions and diversification of those regions and within their villages.
The desired forms in the selection procedures were entirely dependent upon the various regions and diversification by each villages even in the same regions.
sen.cmt: of those～→by each～ に修正しました。
sen.e: The desired forms in the selection procedures were entirely dependent upon the various regions and diversification by each villages even in the same regions.

sen.j: 役職を勤めることによって得られる役給は、(1)領主から支給される場合、(2)「村入用」と呼ばれる村の財政から支給される場合、(3)「給田」などと決められた土地が支給される場合の3つがあった。
sen.e: There were three types of compensation for serving in these positions: (1) Payments by a feudal load: (2) Payments through village finance, called "Muraninyo": (3) Payments in designated land, named "Kyuden."

There were three types of compensation for serving in these positions: (1) Payments by a feudal load: (2) Payments through village finance, called 'Muraninyo': (3) Payments in designated land, named 'Kyuden.'
sen.cmt: クオーテーションマークを修正しました。
sen.e: There were three types of compensation for serving in these positions: (1) Payments by a feudal load: (2) Payments through village finance, called 'Muraninyo': (3) Payments in designated land, named 'Kyuden.'

sen.j: そのあり方は、地域差があるばかりではなく、同じ地域内でも村ごとに多様である。
sen.e: These desired forms of compensational practice were dependent on the various regions diversification and village identity within a region.
These desired forms of compensational practice were dependent on the various regions and diversification by each village even in the same regions.
sen.cmt: diversification以下を、and diversification～same regions. としました。
sen.e: These desired forms of compensational practice were dependent on the various regions and diversification by each village even in the same regions.

tit.e: O-joya (also pronounced "O-shoysa"; a superior village headman, a village official)
O-joya (also pronounced "O-shoya"; a superior village headman, a village official)
O-joya (also pronounced "O-shoya"; a superior village headman, a village official)

sen.j: また、庄屋・名主と異なり、数か村から10数か村の範囲を管轄する大庄屋という役職が置かれた場合もある。
sen.e: Additionally, there were independent positions of the Nanushi or Shoya, some of which were cases of the feudal lords establishing positions for village oversight; this would have been implemented over several villages to several clusters of ten villages, the 'O-joya' would be the assigned administrator in these cases.
Differing from the Nanushi or Shoya, there were some cases that the position called Oshoya (a big village headman) was established to control several villages or more.
sen.cmt: there were independent positions→Differing from とし、some of which以下全体を変えました。
sen.e: Differing from the Nanushi or Shoya, there were some cases that the position called Oshoya (a big village headman) was established to control several villages or more.

sen.j: なお地域によって呼称は多様であり、大名主・割元・大肝煎・十村・郷頭などとも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Besides 'O-joya' this position's name would vary by region under the names of: "Onanushi," "Warimoto (a village official)," "Kimoiri (a sponsor, middleman, and also a village official)," "To-mura (a manger or an official to control villages, ten villages or more as a group)", and "Gougashira."

Besides 'O-joya,' this position's name varied by region under the names of: "Onanushi," "Warimoto (a village official)," "Kimoiri (a sponsor, middleman, and also a village official)," "To-mura (a manger or an official to control villages, ten villages or more as a group)", and "Gougashira."

Besides 'O-joya,' this position's name varied by region under the names of: "Onanushi," "Warimoto (a village official)," "Kimoiri (a sponsor, middleman, and also a village official)," "To-mura (a manger or an official to control villages, ten villages or more as a group)", and "Gougashira."

tit.e: Shoya and Nanushi of a town
Shoya and Nanushi of a town
Shoya and Nanushi of a town
Function
Function
Function
Nanushi of Edo (old name of Tokyo)
Nanushi in Edo (old name of Tokyo)
Nanushi in Edo (old name of Tokyo)

sen.j: 江戸の町の本来の構成員は家持＝町人であり、名主はその町の代表者であった。
sen.e: Since, only an original homeowner could be counted as a town resident, towns in the Edo period organized their members who were homeowners, and then a Nanushi was appointed to represent a town.
Edo town was originally composed of only homeowners, that is townspeople, and Nanushi was a representative of a town.
sen.cmt: 「江戸の町」を主語として文の構成全体を修正しました。
sen.e: Edo town was originally composed of only homeowners, that is townspeople, and Nanushi was a representative of a town.

sen.j: しかし、江戸では家持層が早くから不在となる場合が多く、17世紀末には町の名主は姿を消してしまう。
sen.e: However in towns of the Edo period, the homeowner class disappeared early, and finally the Nanushi representation for the towns ceased at the end of the seventeenth century for the Edo regions.
However, most people of the homeowner class were absent from the town at an early stage and finally Nanushi of a town had disappeared at the end of the seventeenth century in Edo.
sen.cmt: ここで言う「江戸」は江戸の町という意味と思われる為、Edo period→in Edo とし、「不在となる」のは「そこに居住していない」の意味として修正、他全体を修正しました。
sen.e: However, most people of the homeowner class were absent from the town at an early stage and finally Nanushi of a town had disappeared at the end of the seventeenth century in Edo.

sen.j: 町の名主に代わり、家持の代理人＝家守（やもり）の代表である。
sen.e: Instead of a Nanushi of the town a "Yamori (a manger who works for a homeowner or a landowner)," who was to become a deputy of the homeowner, emerged.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Instead of a Nanushi of the town, Yamori (a manger who works for a homeowner or a landowner) who was to become a deputy of the homeowner, emerged.
sen.cmt: コンマ、クオーテーションマークを修正しました。
sen.e: Instead of a Nanushi of the town, Yamori (a manger who works for a homeowner or a landowner) who was to become a deputy of the homeowner, emerged.

sen.j: 家守（やもり）の代表である月行事（がちぎょうじ）が町を代表するようになる。
sen.e: Then, a representative "Gachi-gyoji" was selected from among the Yamori personnel, to represent a town.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, Gachi-gyoji who was a representative of Yamori came to be a representative of a town.
sen.cmt: 文の構成全体を修正しました。
sen.e: Then, Gachi-gyoji who was a representative of Yamori came to be a representative of a town.

tit.e: Nanushi of local castle towns
Nanushi of local castle towns
Nanushi of local castle towns

sen.j: 町年寄（大坂など）
sen.e: Machi-doshiyori (ward head: Osaka and other region)
Machi-doshiyori (ward head: Osaka and other region)
Machi-doshiyori (ward head: Osaka and other region)

sen.j: 年寄（姫路市など）
sen.e: Toshiyori (Himeji City and other region)
Toshiyori (Himeji City and other region)
Toshiyori (Himeji City and other region)

sen.j: 名主年寄（岡山市など）
sen.e: Nanushi Toshiyori (Okayama City and other region)
Nanushi Toshiyori (Okayama City and other region)
Nanushi Toshiyori (Okayama City and other region)

sen.j: 肝入（金沢市など）
sen.e: Kimoiri (Kanazawa City and other region)
Kimoiri (Kanazawa City and other region)
Kimoiri (Kanazawa City and other region)

sen.j: 検断・肝煎（仙台市など）
sen.e: Kendan (policing and adjudication authority) and Kimoiri (Sendai City and other region)
Kendan (policing and adjudication authority) and Kimoiri (Sendai City and other region)
Kendan (policing and adjudication authority) and Kimoiri (Sendai City and other region)

sen.j: 検断（会津若松市など）
sen.e: Kendan (Aizuwakamatsu City and adjudication authority)
Kendan (adjudication authority: Aizuwakamatsu City and other region)
sen.cmt: 上記の表記と合わせました。
sen.e: Kendan (adjudication authority: Aizuwakamatsu City and other region)

sen.j: 町代（名古屋市・犬山市・長岡市など）
sen.e: Chodai (a town official to assist the government officials called a Machi Doshiyori or Machi Nanushi in Edo Period: Nagoya City, Inuyama City, Nagaoka City, and other regions)
Chodai (a town official to assist the government officials called a Machi Doshiyori or Machi Nanushi in Edo Period: Nagoya City, Inuyama City, Nagaoka City, and other regions)
Chodai (a town official to assist the government officials called a Machi Doshiyori or Machi Nanushi in Edo Period: Nagoya City, Inuyama City, Nagaoka City, and other regions)

sen.j: 庄屋（岡崎市・飯田市など）
sen.e: Shoya (Okazaki City, Iida City, and other regions)
Shoya (Okazaki City, Iida City, and other regions)
Shoya (Okazaki City, Iida City, and other regions)

sen.j: 丁頭（駿府など）
sen.e: Cho-Kashira [(丁頭) It may be pronounced, "Cho-Atama" or "Cho-To": Sunpu and other regions)
Cho-Kashira (丁頭: Sunpu and other regions)
sen.cmt: 「丁頭」の読み方不明です。カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: Cho-Kashira (丁頭: Sunpu and other regions)

tit.e: A house of Shoya
A house of Shoya
A house of Shoya

sen.j: 一般の農家より大きく、現在に残っている庄屋､大庄屋屋敷は、主屋・長屋門などに歴史的価値のあるものが多い。
sen.e: A typical Shoya house would be larger than a general house of the farmers, many of the remained Shoya houses and residences of the Ojoya (a superior village headman), which exist today, have historical value, especially the omoya (main building) and Nagaya-mon gate.

A typical Shoya house was larger than that of the general farmers, many residences of Shoya and Ojoya, which remained today, have historical value, especially the omoya (main building) and Nagaya-mon Gate.
sen.cmt: would be→was, a general house of→that of the general, Shoya houses～the Ojoya→residences of Shoya and Ojoya, gate→Gate とし、remained, existedと同様の意味の為、existed→remainedとしました。Ojoyaは初出でないので補足を除きました。
sen.e: A typical Shoya house was larger than that of the general farmers, many residences of Shoya and Ojoya, which remained today, have historical value, especially the omoya (main building) and Nagaya-mon Gate.

sen.j: ※説明中の「重要文化財」は国の重要文化財を指す。
sen.e: *"Important Cultural Property" in the following sentences refers to the "national important cultural property in Japan."
Important Cultural Property' in the following sentences refers to the national important cultural property in Japan.
sen.cmt: クオーテーションマークを修正しました。
sen.e: Important Cultural Property' in the following sentences refers to the national important cultural property in Japan.

sen.j: 門脇家住宅（鳥取県西伯郡大山町）。
sen.e: The Kadowaki family residence (Daisen-cho, Saihaku District, Tottori Prefecture)
The Kadowaki family residence (Daisen-cho, Saihaku District, Tottori Prefecture)
The Kadowaki family residence (Daisen-cho, Saihaku District, Tottori Prefecture)

sen.j: 母屋は重要文化財。
sen.e: The core to the building of the Kadowaki family residence is an Important Cultural Property.
The main housing of the Kadowaki family residence is designated as an Important Cultural Property.
sen.cmt: 「母屋」core to the building→main housing とし、designated as を加えました。
sen.e: The main housing of the Kadowaki family residence is designated as an Important Cultural Property.

sen.j: 学習院大学名誉教授､門脇卓爾の実家。
sen.e: The Kadowaki family residence is the paternal ancestral home of Mr. Takuji KADOWAKI, an emeritus professor of the Gakushuin University.
It is the parents' home of Takuji KADOWAKI, an emeritus professor of the Gakushuin University.
sen.cmt: The Kadowaki family residenceの部分を省略、実家をparents' home としました。
sen.e: It is the parents' home of Takuji KADOWAKI, an emeritus professor of the Gakushuin University.

sen.j: 庄司家住宅（鳥取県境港市）。
sen.e: The Shoji family residence (Sakaiminato City, Tottori Prefecture)
The Shoji family residence (Sakaiminato City, Tottori Prefecture)
The Shoji family residence (Sakaiminato City, Tottori Prefecture)

sen.j: 女優の司葉子は分家出身。
sen.e: Actress Youko TUKASA was born into a branch family of the Shoji family.
An actress Youko TSUKASA was born into a branch family of the Shoji family.
sen.cmt: Actress→An actress としました。TUKASA→TSUKASA に修正しました。
sen.e: An actress Youko TSUKASA was born into a branch family of the Shoji family.

sen.j: 深田家住宅（鳥取県米子市）
sen.e: The Fukada Family residence (Yonago City, Tottori Prefecture)
The Fukada family residence (Yonago City, Tottori Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 上記の文に合わせ、Family →family としました。
sen.e: The Fukada family residence (Yonago City, Tottori Prefecture)

sen.j: 国の名勝。
sen.e: The Fukada Family residence is a place of Scenic Beauty and is designated as a National Scenic Beauty.
It is designated as a place of scenic beauty.
sen.cmt: The Fukada Family residence を省略、Scenic Beautyが2度出ているので修正しました。
sen.e: It is designated as a place of scenic beauty.

sen.j: 隠岐国に配流された後醍醐天皇を迎えるために造った庭園。
sen.e: The garden was constructed to welcome the Emperor Godaigo when he was exiled to the Oki Province.
The garden was constructed to welcome the Emperor Godaigo when he was exiled to the Oki Province.
The garden was constructed to welcome the Emperor Godaigo when he was exiled to the Oki Province.

sen.j: 旧庄屋永沼家住宅（福岡県京都郡みやこ町）
sen.e: Former Shoya, the Naganuma family residence (Miyako-machi, Miyako County, Fukuoka Prefecture)
The former Shoya, the Naganuma family residence (Miyako-machi, Miyako County, Fukuoka Prefecture)
The former Shoya, the Naganuma family residence (Miyako-machi, Miyako County, Fukuoka Prefecture)

sen.j: 重要文化財。
sen.e: The Naganuma family residence is an Important Cultural Property.
It is designated as an Important Cultural Property.
sen.cmt: The Naganuma family residence を省略、designated as を加えました。
sen.e: It is designated as an Important Cultural Property.

sen.j: 大鐘家住宅「花庄屋」（静岡県牧之原市）

sen.j: 中家住宅（大阪府熊取町）

The Naka family residence (Kumatori-cho, Osaka Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 上記の文に合わせ、Family →family としました。town→cho としました。

sen.e: The Naka Family residence is an Important Cultural Property.

sen.j: 元鹿島建設会長鹿島守之助の生家。

It is the birthplace of Morinosuke KAJIMA, the former chairman of the Kajima Construction Corporation, Ltd.

sen.j: 上時国家住宅（かみときくに）住宅（石川県輪島市）

sen.e: The Kamitokikuni family residence is an Important Cultural Property.
It is designated as an Important Cultural Property.
sen.cmt: The Kamitokikuni family residenceを省略、designated as を加えました。

sen.j: 主屋ほか2棟。
sen.e: The designated Important Cultural Properties within the residence grounds are the omoya (main building) and two other buildings.
The residence consists of omoya (main building) and two other buildings.
sen.cmt: The designated～grounds are→The residence consists of としました。
sen.e: The residence consists of omoya (main building) and two other buildings.

sen.j: 平時忠の子、時国の末裔とされる。
sen.e: The Kamitokikuni family is considered to be a descendant of Tokikuni, a child of TAIRA no Tokitada.
